summary:
I am a creative and eager  Industrial Design Engineer with affinity for medical devices and life-supporting product development. With a pragmatic, yet idealistic view of the world I tackle projects. There is no 'we cannot do that', there is only the challenge of 'how are we going to tackle that'.

In my work my business mindset drives me to excel, while my user oriented view of the world drives me to make the best products and value. I use these to strive for the best and to take the lead of a project or topic. To defend my own within these projects and topics I keep immersing myself in the fields of manufacturing, innovation and project management; consistently try to challenge my personal beliefs and those of others.

projects.title: Robot Eva 2.0
projects.description: Continuation of project Robot Eva that was started during the minor period. The focus of the 2.0 project was on making the robot more robust and suitable for field research application in residential care home facilities. Eva 2.0 was tested and evaluated with actual clients and healthcare professionals using techniques including Wizard of Oz. The robot could be controlled using an Oculus Rift VR-headset.

contributors.headline: Founder & CEO at Reconnai Co., Ltd.
Co-Founder at Jitter. Electronic design, embedded systems, Rust | Frogwatch vibration monitoring

projects.title: Firm representative at Industrial Design Engineering Bachelor Thesis
projects.description: Representative for the family firm during a Bachelor Thesis project on IDE. Students had to develop a new fitness machine for rehabilitating persons, e.g. a person in a wheelchair. I ensured the firms interests and qualitities were taken into account during the design process. I also reflected on students' proposals and helped them with questions regarding the target group.

projects.title: Intelligent wearable device for osteoarthritis patients - Philips
projects.description:
Osteoarthritis is a group of mechanical abnormalities in the body that causes symptoms including pain, stiffness, tenderness and locking. The symptoms are more likely to appear when a person is overexercising himself; this makes the affliction especially destructive for overworkers - people that highly motivated to keep on working even when experiencing pain.
The aim of the project is to create concepts to allow the overworker to continue working, but in a controlled manner that can be considered healthier and more sustainable for the functioning of the overworker. This design process contains an internal analysis on Philips, an external analysis of the industry, an analysis of the user and an analysis of uncertainty in the design. A product design is made based on these analysis.

projects.title: Homecare robot Eva
projects.description: Minor project at Delft University of Technology during which a homecare robot dubbed "Eva" was developed. Several aspects of this project included user research with over 200 health care professionals, CAD design, prototype building and presenting of robot Eva at several fairs and tv-shows.

volunteer_experiences.description:

● Organized group activities, including foreign trips (Luxembourg, Belgium, United Kingdom)

Committee member for the Delftsche Zwervers on organization of camps for underprivileged children, i.e. those receiving food aid.
